places_with_reviews.name: Sherabling Monastery
places_with_reviews.address: Baijnath Bhattu monastery, Keori, Himachal Pradesh 176125, India

reviews.text: The most beautiful monastery I have seen. It's just renovated.. colours are so aesthetic and cool. If you are in bir please visit this beautiful place. Campus is so huge and lively.

Loved the place, huge monastery with a cricket and football ground and school.  Very peaceful environment in the quiet. They hv a cafe run by the monks and is recommended to visit on your trip. Souvenir shops are loacted near to this cafe. The drive to this is less than 30 mts from Bir. Keep this place on Yr itenary.

The Sherabling Monastery is located inside a larger complex which houses not just the monastery but also a monastic school, monastic residential complex and other monuments as well. The entry to the monastery is free, one only  needs to register at the entrance. It is advisable to ask the guards before entering the way to the monastery or follow the location on maps as once inside the complex there are many paths and you could get lost. The monastery is a quiet and serene space which houses a large idol of the Buddha. Photography and videography are not allowed inside. As a sign of respect it is advisable to maintain silence. The other building worth visiting inside the complex are the eight stupas. These are located an almost 20 mins walk away from the main monastery. Vehicles are not permitted inside and walking is the only option available. But it is worth visiting if you are in Bir.
It is a good place to hang out. You will find peace and good aura there. You must be good at walking if you want to explore every portion of the monastery. Although there must be some good eateries.

A very peaceful monastery, must visit when in Bir. It also houses an institute for Buddhist studies. You can visit the monastery at anytime during the day. They have a guest house as well as a small cafe that serves the most amazing momos and tomato soup.

reviews.text: Keep 2 hours to visit this place for the trek to there and back. A guide is strongly recommended (150 ~ 300 per person), make a deal with the guide. If in a car park at the first opportunity and trek the way up, with a bike u can go a little further. Mesmerizing beauty of the falls. The last 150 meters one needs to walk in the river water to reach the base of the falls. Some tea, Maggi vendors are there for small eats. Enjoy.

This waterfall is not for the faint hearted! Even though its just a 1 km trek, the whole path is like an obstacle course! A guide is a must as the terrain is full of boulders to be scaled and narrow paths where one needs to be alert. The guide charges are around 300 per person and there are no other charges. We took around 3 hrs including the trek to and fro. But all this effort is worth the view and feel to be near the fall. On your way back from the fall, you could indulge in some chai and maggi or even some siddu. It is a lovely experience if in Bir and are up for more adventure than just paragliding.

reviews.text: Best paragliding site in Asia. Even a visit to this place is mesmerizing for the 360 degree view. Visit to the cafe nearby, stay a while and get lost in nature. Enjoy the paragliding takeoff from this points. The drive is about 45 minutes from Bir. Recommend.

Last month, I had the extraordinary opportunity to visit Bir Billing, and it was truly mesmerizing! The highlight of my journey was undoubtedly the majestic ice-capped peaks, the ethereal clouds, and the blissful absence of crowds. I relished immersing myself in the serene beauty of the valley. Additionally, Bir Billing is renowned for its exhilarating paragliding experiences, making it a must-visit destination at other times of the year for thrill-seekers.

It was a wonderful experience flying with this amazing team. My paragliding pilot was karan and he was amazing with his flying skills. He made sure that I had an awesome experience to remember. Thanks to Karan and the team for driving till the takeoff site and making land smoothly. Much recommended to everyone.

Bir Billing is one of the top most famous Paragliding hub located in HP.

Bir is such a lovely place & the beauty of Billing makes it more scenic when you feel it on the top of hills.

Paragliding here is Asia's 2nd highest point & probably the top most reason of more & more tourists here.

Bir has lots of other lovely tourist places ie waterfall, monasteries etc, in main town, lots of nice cafes, hostel etc, this take off site is located around 14km from bir & it's in billing, while the landing site is nearby town itself from where it takes around 15 min walkin to the main town.

Had a very wonderful experience here in trip, so much yummy food across different places, did paragliding, enjoyed waterfall, cafes etc.
People here are very nice & supportive.

It's highly recommended to be here to enjoy natural beauty, adventure sports etc.

reviews.text: I had an absolutely breathtaking experience at this temple! The trek through the serene pine forest was enchanting, and the view from the temple during sunset was simply magical. It's the perfect place to find inner peace and connect with nature. Highly recommended for those seeking tranquility and stunning vistas

Very peaceful and very picturesque! We were lucky to have temple Prasad on the occasion of Navami.

I can’t express how tasty the food was, it was Kangri Dham.

Amazing place to witness sunset and 360 degree view of Kangra Valley.

Located on a hilltop in Ahju around 5 kms from Bir.

We went for sunset and reached on top at 7:20 PM.

There is an area on the top of temple where we couldn’t reach as temple and entry to stairs was closed.

Weather in that area is very unpredictable but luckily we witnessed sunset.

We decided to descend back but it started raining heavily, we found a shelter in a room like area.

There was no one except us 2, I was chilling in a T-shirt underestimating the circumstances.

Priest of the temple also came despite heavy rain showers and asked us to stay in temple for that night as weather was extremely bad.

We waited for 1 hour there and started descending slowly at 8:30 PM and reached down at 9 PM.

We had MATA MAHESHWARI Blessings with us.

I will not recommend anyone to go there solo in evenings.

TREK -

It is a moderate trek of 45-60 minutes starting from a white coloured gate with “Jai Mata Maheshwari” written on it.

To be honest, Trek is not easy. Don’t rush. Keep food and water with you as there will be no shops and person around to help at odd times.

It is also visible from Landing site as a mobile tower is placed on top of the temple.

Date of Visit - 5th June, 2023

Whether you're a nature enthusiast, a spiritual seeker, or simply in search of a breathtaking view, a visit to Mata Maheshwari Temple promises an unforgettable encounter with nature's grandeur. Let the sunset at this majestic temple in Bir be etched in your memories as a moment of pure awe and wonder.

Baglamukhi Devi Temple,
Kangra, Himachal Pradesh.

Located 30 km away from Kangra District in Himachal Pradesh near Dharamshala, the Baglamukhi Devi temple is surrounded by the Dhauladhar range of Himalayas. The name Baglamukhi is derived from two Sanskrit words “Bagla”, which means bride and “Mukhi”, meaning face. The temple is among the many establishments scattered in various other parts of the country dedicated to Goddess Baglamukhi.

Around 30 km from Kangra District, Baglamukhi Temple is a Siddha Peeth close to both Jwala Ji and Chintpurni Devi Temple. The deity, Baglamukhi is one of the 10 Mahavidyas and believed to be the destroyer of all evils. Yellow colour is the most favourite colour of the Goddess. That is why the temple is painted in yellow colour. The devotees do wear yellow attire and yellow desserts (besan ki laddoo) are offered to the deity. People worship the deity to win the legal confrontations, to defeat their enemy, to prosper in business and to win the heart of beloved.

The name Bagalamukhi comes from two separate Sanskrit words, 'Bagala' meaning 'bride' and 'mukhi' meaning 'face'. In essence, it translates to the deity having captivating and hypnotising powers in her face or herself which fights the evil away. It is said that yellow is the favourite colour of the goddess which is why the Baglamukhi Temple has been painted yellow in colour. All the worshippers of the Goddess wear yellow coloured clothes, and yellow sweets are offered to the deity. Many festivals are celebrated at Maa Baglamukhi Temple including Navratri, Guru Purnima, Vasant Panchami, and other special pujas and aarthis.

It is considered that the Goddess loved the yellow color, and hence the temple is painted vibrantly in the yellow shade. The entrance, all the domes and the pillars are painted in yellow. Inside a tiered dome, which is supported by pillars, there is a huge prodigious havankund. The holy place enshrines the idol of Goddess Baglamukhi embellished with yellow ornaments, garments, and flowers.

Baglamukhi is one among the ten mahavidyas, the wisdom goddesses. Her abode is considered to be a Sidha Peetha. According to the mythology, she emerged on hearing the prayers of other Gods when the huge storm has erupted over the earth. It is believed that she calmed the storm, and since then she is worshipped as the enemy destroyer. This temple is one among the pars of famous Nava Shaktipeeth Yatra.

The temple is located in Bakhandi, Sameli, Himachal Pradesh. It is well connected by roads to various other parts of the state. Buses and taxi facility are available from cities like Delhi, Una, Chandigarh. Hoshiarpur, etc. The best time to visit the temple is during the month of October for the auspicious Navratri celebrations, celebrated with great joy, style, grandeur and vigour.
